summary: Email chain between Assistant United States Attorney and Jill Greenfield, a partner at Fieldfisher law firm, regarding scheduling a videoconference with Greenfield's client to discuss matters related to the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistical challenges due to COVID-19 travel restrictions and mention an updated investigation team.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who wishes to speak with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the Epstein investigation. She initiates contact to schedule a discussion.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Government prosecutor corresponding with Jill Greenfield to arrange a videoconference with her client regarding the Epstein investigation. Mentions travel restrictions for government employees.

connections.description: Corresponding to schedule a discussion between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Greenfield's client regarding the Epstein investigation.
Greenfield is the legal representative for a client who wishes to speak with prosecutors about the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial contact from Jill Greenfield
events.description: Jill Greenfield emails the U.S. Attorney's Office indicating her client wants to speak to them to discuss matters, asking if they are traveling.

events.title: Scheduling discussion for videoconference
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a videoconference between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jill Greenfield's client, noting COVID-19 travel restrictions prevent in-person meeting.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
London, England (Fieldfisher office at Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT)
keyFacts: A client of attorney Jill Greenfield sought to speak with U.S. prosecutors about the Epstein investigation in September 2020.
The correspondence indicates the investigation was active and ongoing at that time, with an updated prosecution team.
COVID-19 travel restrictions in 2020 prevented government prosecutors from traveling internationally for in-person meetings, necessitating a videoconference.
The emails reference logistical coordination between a UK-based law firm and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
